results.content:
- Got enough information for applying with appropriate approach as my intention, understanding each component in MEAN stack and integrate each of them step by step to a complete project.

- Duration of each lessons is long enough.

- Not clear voice and voice recording causes annoying by continuous short interrupts.

- Not present the clear structure of project, a little bit fuzzy or messy for client and server sides.
results.content_html:
- Got enough information for applying with appropriate approach as my intention, understanding each component in MEAN stack and integrate each of them step by step to a complete project.

- Duration of each lessons is long enough.

- Not clear voice and voice recording causes annoying by continuous short interrupts.

- Not present the clear structure of project, a little bit fuzzy or messy for client and server sides.

results.content: Clear and concise lectures with lots of animations to keep you engaged instead of just staring at slides.
results.content_html: Clear and concise lectures with lots of animations to keep you engaged instead of just staring at slides.

results.content: Very useful lectures.  It is definitely the best I have found - covers everything that I need to start my university project.  Thank you for sharing such useful information.
results.content_html: Very useful lectures. It is definitely the best I have found - covers everything that I need to start my university project. Thank you for sharing such useful information.

results.content: The course is good prepared and filled with good topics but sometimes it is not easy to follow, when code only pated in. I tried to follow along, and then there came some parts, where I had to find out, if the code on the screen is correct if I did mistakes when typing. But this as well helps, trying to find typos.

results.content: Build web applications using MEAN stack hands on.

results.content: The course covers MEAN in a well organized way and covers all the essential concepts of MEAN from installation to deployment things have been presented very well
